{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3340328,"name":"Will Weiszhaar","username":"trig","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ebca7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-22T02:20:02.179Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone,

Throughout our entire season our odometry has been off, and we were able to ignore it until recently. After first competition we wanted to work on improving our autos (which were short and allowed us to ignore the issue for the most part) in which we realized that the odometry was severely off by 2 or more feet at the end of the path (one of the notes on the center line). The pose is also off when we start in a location, drive around, and then return to the same location. I’ve tried several solutions but to no avail. Any help on solving this issue would be greatly appreciated!

Drive Subsystem Code

Swerve Module Code

What have you tried that didn’t work?

The most likely things to be wrong are your gear ratio or you wheel circumstance. The carpet has an effect as well. We usually get our gear ratio set, and then adjust our wheel circumstance in the code until we’re happy with the result.

You have a weird starting pose, but I don’t see a problem with it. Just seems odd to always be starting on the red side facing toward the red alliance wall.

I will try looking at the wheel circumference, as I have a suspicion that It could be wrong.

What have you tried that didn’t work?

I’ve tried adjusting the kinematics object as we thought that could have been an issue, but we didn’t really see an improvement. That’s all we’ve really done besides checking for sign errors in the code

You have a weird starting pose, but I don’t see a problem with it. Just seems odd to always be starting on the red side facing toward the red alliance wall.

It was a left over from testing that probably should be changed, but It has no effect on our matches as pathplanner resets the odometry to the starting pose of the auton anyways.

if you drive slowly in a straight line exactly one measured meter, does the robot also indicate the correct distance? that will tell you if the wheel size is correct.

another thing that can mess up odometry-based path following is if your steering pid controllers are too soft. your value of 6.5 means that for a substantial error of 0.1 radians, you’re only pushing 0.65 volts, which won’t work to move anything. try raising the P value by a huge amount. with the wheels on carpet there’s quite a bit of friction in the steering axis, so the oscillation limit is pretty high.

Sorry for taking so long to respond, but we determined that it was probably due to wheel slippage on the carpet. Thanks!

What did you do that improved the situation (or have you)

We changed our treads at worlds, and that seemed to help a little bit. During the offseason we want to try a bunch of different solutions that could help as well; Mainly trying some 3d printed wheels that have better grip and also trying to generate better paths through tools like choreo that respect the physical limitations of the robot.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-05-08T18:01:23.818Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":26.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459655,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-odometry-severely-deviates-from-actual-pose","display_username":"Will Weiszhaar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54449,"username":"cgp","name":"cgp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cgp/{size}/205629_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65296,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-odometry-severely-deviates-from-actual-pose/459655/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3565187,"name":"Will Weiszhaar","username":"trig","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ebca7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-22T03:26:12.561Z","cooked":"

Finally responding here to give some closure to this issue. We finally did a deep dive into our issues this season and found some solutions that work well:

  1. Tune wheel radius! This has helped improve our tracking in between vision poses massively.
  2. Use Vision! We got a good vision stack this year and that has helped immensely.
  3. Use known good code. We switched to modified advantage kit template and that helped gain confidence in our system to begin tuning other parameters

With these changes, we were able to get consistent, usable poses throughout the entire match. Thanks to everyone who helped suggest changes along the way!
